qas.question: What caused high unemployment on the island?
Who is the only reigning Monarch to have visited the island?
What year did King George VI visit the island?
When did Prince Phillip arrive in Saint Helena?
Prince Andrews, son of Prince Phillip visited in what year?

context: One commentator has observed that, notwithstanding the high unemployment resulting from the <a0_0>loss of full passports<a0_0/> during 1981–2002, the level of loyalty to the British monarchy by the St Helena population is probably not exceeded in any other part of the world. <a1_0>King George VI<a1_0/> is the only reigning monarch to have visited the island. This was in <a2_0>1947<a2_0/> when the King, accompanied by Queen Elizabeth (later the Queen Mother), Princess Elizabeth (later Queen Elizabeth II) and Princess Margaret were travelling to South Africa. Prince Philip arrived at St Helena in <a3_0>1957<a3_0/> and then his son Prince Andrew visited as a member of the armed forces in <a4_0>1984<a4_0/> and his sister the Princess Royal arrived in 2002.
